FW Current Draft DASH Huntco for reviewMessage From Barbour Karen L Sent Thursday April AM To Biggerstaff Finley Metoyer Pam Subject Current Draft DASH Huntco for review The attached draft DASH is being reviewed by Dave Gorte Please circulate to the signers for review prior to final circulation for signatures

Reminder Underwriting Holiday Luncha Reminder the Underwriting Lunch Brennans is tomorrow We need to leave promptly am in order to make our reservations Lets plan to meet in the th floor lobby Let me know asap if you are unable to attend Thanks Pam Forwarded by Pam MetoyerHOUECT on PM From Pam Metoyer PM To Michael nron James nron David CrewsEnron nron Communications Karen L CT Chip nron Bradford CT Randy CT David CT James CT Jack CT Rick CT Karen K CT Emy NRON cc Subject Underwriting Holiday Lunch Seasons Greetings You are Invited to Attend A Holiday Lunch Date Wednesday December Time am Let the Celebration Begin Location Brennans Restaurant Please mark your calendars for this joyous occasion If you are unable to attend please let me know so that I may have a firm count for our reservations HAPPY HOLIDAYS

Memo from Rick with attachmentBuy PM To All RAC Houston London Employees cc Subject RAC Teams As mentioned in our floor meeting recently attached are listings of teams that we are forming to better address the business needs of Enron as it expands both in volume and scope Supervisors of each RAC sub group provided the names for the groups with the understanding that they may have to be adjusted from time to time Only the more senior people were included but others will be included as appropriate Many will have to be multidimensional There will be no formal leader of the teams because each member is responsible for the activities of the team regardless of the RAC group that you are in Following are several thoughts concerning this process for consideration The purpose of this exercise is to better serve the customer the commercial business units and achieve this within our control framework Ancillary benefits include cross training of RAC employees and heightened awareness of RAC issues Desiloization All existing reporting relationships remain unchanged for the moment Successful implementation of this effort will require a positive attitude among the teams Existing RAC responsibilities remain in effect Teams should meet weekly at least to discuss issues Transactions will require more frequent informal meetings There are no excuses for forgetting to consider the impact on a deal of credit market risk or our portfolio All team members are responsible for all aspects of a transaction Offer to help out if needed If formal crosstraining is necessary force it to happen Encourage weak links in team to perform Each quarter RAC management will conduct portfolio reviews of the business unit with the team present This may take one quarter to implement If it makes sense to sit together for logistical reasons try to arrange it with your supervisor Individual performance on the teams will be strongly considered in the PRC and compensation processes The existing EES team has been quite successful and in large part was a catalyst to the recent reorganization there You can have an impact This process should begin immediately Thanks in advance for your cooperation in this effort Rick

FW Credit Risk PresentationTradingpst Original Message From Jolly Kevin Sent Friday May PM To Metoyer Pam Subject Credit Risk Presentation This is the presentation done by Dave Gorte Friday May in the credit risk training Please forward the file to all of RAC Thanks Kevin
Credit Risk Management Class EBCTradingpst REMINDER The Credit Risk Management Class will be held today starting promptly at pm in Training Room EBC

RAC TrainingTradingpst In place of tomorrows RAC training session we will be holding a feedback session regarding the RAC internal training program in general We are interested in hearing what materials each of you would be interested in learning more about and any other ideas you may have related to these sessions Our goal is to establish a more structured agenda and possibly course outlines or objectives for future sessions In establishing a more structured program we could then apply for CPE credits and provide a calendar of future topics for all to view from the RAC website Please bring your creative ideas to tomorrows feedback session or feel free to email to me any ideas you may want to discuss at tomorrows session Friday pm EBC Thank you Stephanie

RAC Employee Floor Meeting Friday June Tradingpst There will be a RAC Employee Floor Meeting this Friday June th from am near Conference Room EB See you there Rick Buy

FW RAC Training PostponedTradingpst Please Note The RAC Training Session for today has been postponed until next Friday Ju ne pm in EBC Please adjust your calendars to reflect this change Original RAC Happy Hour Thursday May Tradingpst FROM RICK BUY To All RAC Employees Date Thursday May rd Time pm pm Place Slick Willies Southwest Freeway Houston TX Food P F Changs Food drinks pool tables and just plain fun getting to know other RAC employees Please RSVP before Friday April th to Flavia Negrete at This is a RAC employees only event
